data.description: In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next! At Parsons, you can imagine a career where you thrive, work with exceptional people, and be yourself. Guided by our leadership vision of valuing people, embracing agility, and fostering growth, we cultivate an innovative culture that empowers you to achieve your full potential. Unleash your talent and redefine what’s possible. Job Description:**US Citizenship required due to Federal Government Requirement**Do you want to design, develop, and deliver bleeding-edge technical solutions in the national cyber security domain?Parsons Special Programs and Systems group is hiring cleared software engineers to develop specialized software within a first-class team of developers, computer scientists, and cyber specialists. Specifically, you will have the opportunity to:Intern for the summer or do a longer Co-OpParticipate in or lead design and code reviewsCreate real-time/stream/batch processing softwareDevelop scalable, web-based data visualization and analytic platforms using Java, Spring, servlets, Extract Transform Load (ETL) pipelines, microservices, message brokers, and scalable databases (Hadoop, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL)Build and deploy software using Python, Gradle, Docker, Vagrant, Ansible, Maven, Gitlab, and/or Bash.Learn about new software and hardware technology platformsRequired Qualifications:Active Top Secret SCI clearanceWork in person in Centreville, VAWorking towards a degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, or a related disciplineJava, C++, or JavaScript development skillsDesired Qualifications:Active polygraphExperience working in a Linux development environmentKnowledge of networking concepts including the OSI modelDevOps experience with Jenkins, Gitlab, Gradle, CMake, Zabbix, and/or VagrantC++ experience with Boost, TBB, and/or DPDKVirtual machine and/or containerization experience with VMWare, Libvirt, Docker, and/or PodmanDeployment script experience with Ansible or SaltOperational Linux skills with technology such as SNMP, NTP, Systemd, Cron, DNF, and/or Git.Structured Query Language (SQL) experience for example with MySQL or PostgreSQLNoSQL experience for example with Hadoop, Elasticsearch, or MongoDBSpring Boot experienceScripting experience for example with Python, Bash, or ShellFront-end (full-stack) development experience with Angular and Material-UI using TypeScriptSecurity Clearance Requirement:An active Top Secret SCI security clearance is required for this position.​This position is part of our Federal Solutions team.The Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.Salary Range: $21.88 - $38.27We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as 401K!Parsons is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected status.We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!Parsons is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices. To learn more about recruitment fraud and how to report it, please refer to https://www.parsons.com/fraudulent-recruitment/.
